p: Homology studies using Candida Genome Database showed that Candida accounts for type III 5-α-reductase, Dfg10p, and shares a 27% sequence identity and 41% similarity to the human type III 5-α-reductase, which were identified as a target for benign prostatic hyperplasia. Finasteride 13 was recognized as one of the potent inhibitors against type III 5-α-reductase. Studying its activity showed some promising results at dose ≥16 mg/liter. Finasteride alone was highly efficient in preventing filamentation of C. albicans and demonstrated synergy with FLC against in vitro urinary biofilm ( Chavez-Dozal et al., 2014).
